incident_updates.body: We have determined the origin of the incident affecting our Backbone infrastructure, which is causing temporary latency increase between SYDNEY and SINGAPORE. Here are some supplementary details : Start time : 18/02/2025 13:40 UTC Impacted Service : Links between SYDNEY and SINGAPORE backbone infrastructure are unreachable . Customers Impact : Customers are facing latency increase to access their services passing from SYDNEY and SINGAPORE. Ongoing Actions : Our teams are currently working with our provider to resolve the issue as quickly as possible. We will keep you updated on the progress and resolution. We apologize for any inconvenience caused and appreciate your understanding.

As part of our continuous improvement plan, maintenance is scheduled on our network infrastructure. Start time : 18/02/2025 21:00 UTC End time : 19/02/2025 06:00 UTC Service impact : None Service improvement : As part of our continuous improvement policy of our network infrastructure, we will have to carry out interventions on multiple network equipment. Thank you for your understanding.

As part of our continuous improvement plan, maintenance is scheduled on our electrical infrastructure. This will affect availability of your servers. Start time : 18/02/2025 21:00 UTC End time : 19/02/2025 00:00 UTC Service impact : Servers will be unavailable during the maintenance operation. Service improvement : Following our continuous improvement policy of our products and services, we will carry out an electrical upgrade in our Graveline Datacenters. To protect your data from any impact, we advise you to first restart your machines in rescue mode (How to activate and use rescue mode) before the operation mentioned above. Every client concerned by this maintenance will be contacted. Thank you for your understanding.

As part of the continuous improvement of our services, we have planned an evolution of the network infrastructure on the Limburg site on February 24, 2025. Start time : 24/02/2025 21:00 UTC End time : 25/02/2025 05:00 UTC Service impact : None expected Service improvement : Network scaling capacity This maintenance will be structured around three phases, described in detail below: Step 1 : preparation of the maintenance operation (about 2 hours) Step 2 : implementation of the new infrastructure (about 3 hours) Step 3 : test and activation of the new infrastructure (about3 hours) We apologize for any inconvenience this may cause and appreciate your understanding as we work to improve our services. Thank you for your understanding.
